cip.render.util3d

Class Quadric3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • cip.render.util3d.Quadric3f

  • public class Quadric3f
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing a a family of quadrics centered at 0,0,0 in object space and with the Z axis being the primary axis of the shape. The quadric is described in 3D of single precision (the components are represented by float values), hence the name Quadric3f.

    A quadric is implicitly represented by the formula:

    q1i2 + q2j2 + q3k2 + q4xy + q5yz + q6zx + q7i + q8j + q9k +q0 = 0

    This representation allows arbitrary orientation and positioning of quadric shapes. If we limit our consideration to quadric shapes that are centered at the origin and have the Z axis as the major axis of the quadric, the families of quadric shapes are represented as:

    Elliptical Cylinder about k:   q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q0 = -1

    Ellipsoid:  q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = 1/rk2 ;   q0 = -1

    Elliptic Paraboloid about k:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q9 = -1/height

    Elliptic Cone about k:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = -1/height2

    Hyperboloid about k:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = -1/rk2 ;   q0 = -1

    Hyperbolic Paraboloid about k:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = -1/rj2 ;    q9 = -1/rk

    We intersect a ray starting at point (io,jo,ko) and extending in direction (i,j,k), the points along which are expressed as (it,jt,it) = (io,jo,ko) + t(i,j,k) where t is the distance from the origin of the ray (our standard parametric representation of a ray) by doing a bunch of algebraic gymnastics until we can express the combined equations as:

    t2(q1i2 + q2j2 + q3k2 + q4 ij + q5jk + q6ki) +

    t(2(q1ioi + q2joj + q3kok)+ q4(ioj + joi) + q5(jok + koj) + q6(koi + iok) + q7i + q8j + q9k) +

    (q1io2 + q2jo2 + q3ko2 + q4 iojo+ q5joko + q6koio + q7io + q8jo + q9ko + q0)  =  0

    or, put another way:

    at2 + bt + c = 0

    where

    a = q1i2 + q2j2 + q3k2 + q4 ij + q5jk + q6ki

    b = 2(q1ioi + q2joj + q3kok)+ q4(ioj + joi) + q5(jok + koj) + q6(koi + iok) + q7i + q8j + q9k

    c = q1io2 + q2jo2 + q3ko2 + q4 iojo+ q5joko + q6koio + q7io + q8jo + q9ko + q0

    and we can use the quadratic formula to find the roots for t. Note that for our special case of location and orientation, these simplify considerably to:

    a = q1i2 + q2j2 + q3k2

    b = 2(q1ioi + q2joj + q3kok) + q9k

    c = q1io2 + q2jo2 + q3ko2 + q9ko + q0

    To find the normal at a point on the surface, we can take the partials of the formula and express the normal (in,,jn,kn) as:

    u = 2q1i + q4j + q6k + q7

    v = 2q2j + q4i + q5k + q8

    w = 2q3k + q5j + q6i + q9

    in = u / sqrt(u2 + v2 + w2) ;  jn = v / sqrt(u2 + v2 + w2) ;  kn = w / sqrt(u2 + v2 + w2)

    As in the case of the coefficients of the quadratic form, the U, V, and W for normal computation also simplify substantially to:

    u = 2q1i

    v = 2q2j

    w = 2q3k + q9

    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • setEllipticalCylinder

        public Quadric3f setEllipticalCylinder(float fRx,
                                       float fRy)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for an elliptical cylinder about k as:   q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = 0 ;   q0 = -1

        The elliptical cone is an ellipse of radius fRx, fRy centered at 0,0 where it cuts through the XY plane. It extends infinitely in Z.

        Parameters:
        fRx - (float, > 0.0f) The i radius of the elliptical-cylinder.
        fRy - (float, > 0.0f) The j radius of the elliptical-cylinder.
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • setEllipsoid

        public Quadric3f setEllipsoid(float fRx,
                              float fRy,
                              float fRz)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for an ellipsoid as:  q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = 1/rk2 ;   q0 = -1

        The ellipsoid is centered at 0,0,0.

        Parameters:
        fRx - (float, > 0.0f) The i radius of the ellipsoid.
        fRy - (float, > 0.0f) The j radius of the ellipsoid.
        fRz - (float, > 0.0f) The k radius of the ellipsoid.
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • setEllipticalParaboloid

        public Quadric3f setEllipticalParaboloid(float fRx,
                                         float fRy,
                                         float fHeight)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for an elliptic paraboloid about k:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q9 = -1/height

        The elliptical paraboloid has an elliptical cross section centered on the Z axis. The elliptic cross section has i and j radii of fRx,fRy where k = fHeight and k = -fHeight.

        Parameters:
        fRx - The i radius of the cross section where k = fHeight.
        fRy - The j radius of the cross section where k = fHeight.
        fHeight - The k distance from the origin at which the elliptic cross section has i and j radii of fRx,fRy
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • setEllipticalCone

        public Quadric3f setEllipticalCone(float fRx,
                                   float fRy,
                                   float fHeight)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for an elliptic cone about k as:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = -1/height2

        The elliptical cone has an elliptical cross section centered on the Z axis. The elliptic cross section has i and j radii of fRx,fRy where k = fHeight and k = -fHeight.

        Parameters:
        fRx - The i radius of the cross section where k = fHeight and k = -fHeight.
        fRy - The j radius of the cross section where k = fHeight and k = -fHeight.
        fHeight - The k distance from the origin at which the elliptic cross section has i and j radii of fRx,fRy
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • setHyperboloid

        public Quadric3f setHyperboloid(float fRx,
                                float fRy,
                                float fRz)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for a hyperboloid about k as:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = 1/rj2 ;   q3 = -1/rk2 ;   q0 = -1

        The hyperboloid has an elliptical cross section of radius fRx, fRy centered at 0,0 where it cuts through the XY plane. It extends infinitely in Z and flares out (gets larger) as it gets further from k.

        Parameters:
        fRx - The i radius at k = 0.
        fRy - The j radius at k = 0.
        fRz - The k 'radius'. This is not really a radius because the hyperboloid extends infinitely. A small radius means the shape flares rapidly, a large radius means the shape flares gradually. Note that as fRz approaches infinity the q3 term approaches 0 and the hyperboloid becomes an elliptical cylinder.
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • setHyperbolicParaboloid

        public Quadric3f setHyperbolicParaboloid(float fRx,
                                         float fRy,
                                         float fRz)
        Initializes the coefficients of the quadric formula for a hyperbolic paraboloid about j as:    q1 = 1/ri2 ;   q2 = -1/rj2 ;    q9 = -1/rk
        Parameters:
        fRx - The i 'radius'.
        fRy - The j 'radius'.
        fRz - The k 'radius'.
        Returns:
        Returns this quadric after initialization.

      • getQ

        public float getQ(int index)
        Get the quadric coefficient at the specified index.
        Parameters:
        index - The index, from 0 to 9 as described in the class documentation.
        Returns:
        Returns the value of the rquested quadric coefficient.`

      • isConvex

        public boolean isConvex()
        Inquire whether this quadric is convex.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the object is quadric and false if the quadric is not convex or the convexity cannot be verified.

      • isInside

        public boolean isInside(Point3f pt)
        Tests whether a point is inside ot outside a quadric. This might be interesting, for example, for a travelling camera that passes into a crystal ball.
        Parameters:
        pt - (readonly) The point to be tested.
        Returns:
        true if the point is inside the quadric, false otherwise.

      • getIntersection

        public Quadric3fIntersection getIntersection(Quadric3fIntersection quadInt,
                                             Point3f pt,
                                             Vector3f v,
                                             boolean bStartsInside)
        Get the intersection of a ray starting at point pt in the direction v with this quadric. The ray direction should be normalized for the correct intersection distance to be reported.
        Parameters:
        quadInt - (modified) The intersection.
        pt - {readonly} The origin of the ray.
        v - {readnoly} The direction of the ray.
        bStartsInside - false if this is an outside ray, true if this is a ray spawned from an intersection with this object and on the inside of the object. NOTE: this is a logic decision and must be respected - specifically, if the ray starts inside it was because a previous call to this method reported the intersection from the outside. Thus, the only possible next intersection is going out.
        Returns:
        Returns quadInt with the intersection information set.

      • getIntersection

        public Quadric3fIntersection getIntersection(Quadric3fIntersection quadInt,
                                             Line3f ray,
                                             boolean bStartsInside)
        Get the intersection of a ray, ray, with this quadric. The ray direction should be normalized for the correct intersection distance to be reported.
        Parameters:
        quadInt - The intersection.
        ray - The ray.
        bStartsInside - false if this is an outside ray, true if this is a ray spawned from an intersection with this object and on the inside of the object.
        Returns:
        Returns quadInt with the intersection information set.

      • getNormal

        public Vector3f getNormal(Vector3f v,
                          Point3f pt)
        Computes the normal for a point on the surface of the quadric.
        Parameters:
        v - (Vector3f, modified) The normal.
        pt - (Point3f, readonly) The point on the surface of the quadric.
        Returns:
        Returns v set to the normal corresponding to the intersection point.
